Key Match Events: England won by 6 wickets (with 4 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: Seventeen years later, England make their return to Pakistan
The sides have met on neutral soil in the UAE for three tours in the intervening years
England arrive in Pakistan with a debt of gratitude to pay, not to mention an apology hanging in the air
The hosts may still be smarting from their defeat in the recent Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka
As for England, this tour might come to be seen, for better or for worse, as the true start of the Jos Buttler-Matthew Mott era
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's batting order is likely to be flexible depending on favourable match-ups
Pakistan have won six of their previous 20 completed T20Is against England, with 13 losses and a solitary tie in Sharjah in 2015
The two teams last met in the summer of 2021, when England came from behind to win the three-match series 2-1
Others: The teams will observe a minute's silence before the first T20I, in memory of Queen Elizabeth II and victims of the floods in Pakistan
Shaun Tait, Pakistan's bowling coach, talks up Naseem Shah's credentials
Moeen Ali resists the suggestion that England are fielding a weakened side
